meanings.definition: To heat sugar until it turns brown and gives a characteristic flavor.
meanings.sent1: I watched the chef caramelize the sugar for the dessert.
meanings.sent2: She likes to caramelize the onions for her burgers.
meanings.sent3: The sugar decided to caramelize itself in the hot pan.
meanings.sent4: The evening sun seemed to caramelize the clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the caramelize sugar filled the kitchen with sweetness.

meanings.definition: To cook food with sugar until it becomes brown and sweet.
meanings.sent1: Mom will caramelize the apples for the pie.
meanings.sent2: The chef will caramelize the sauce for the dish.
meanings.sent3: The vegetables in the pot started to caramelize on their own.
meanings.sent4: The music seemed to caramelize the atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the caramelize dish made everyone's mouth water.

meanings.definition: To make or become caramel in color or flavor.
meanings.sent1: The sugar will caramelize and turn into a golden syrup.
meanings.sent2: The sauce will caramelize as it simmers on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The paint on the wall seemed to caramelize under the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a caramelize tone that was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent5: The sunset made the sky caramelize into a beautiful orange hue.
